wikipedia_page.main: Carol Adams (28 July 1948 - 11 January 2007) was a history teacher who was the first Chief Executive of the General Teaching Council for England (GTCE), bringing England in line with Scotland and Wales who had had teaching regulatory bodies since 1966. Adams established the organisation (which was not welcomed by some in the profession) as a regulatory body and for professional development organisation, and which was consulted by government, from its foundation in 2000 until it covered over 500,000 teachers, before she retired in late 2006.

response: The Council's first Chief Executive from 2000 until 2006 was educationalist Carol Adams.

link_mentions.page: List of people from the London Borough of Hackney

response: *Carol Adams (educator) (1948–2007), chief executive of the General Teaching Council for England
